instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Hello guys, I have this one with a non-starting failure, on board diagnostic led 1 lights ok, tested with other know working power supply to discard, same behavior.

the S5 lines read: 

PP1V1_S5_REG -> 1.11V

PP3V3_S5_REG -> 3.37V

PP5V_S5_LDO -> 4.98V

PP12V_S5 -> 12.01V 

Seems this are all ok

This one not, too high reading, maybe the same culprit:

PGOOD_1V1_S5 -> 3.37V (should not be 1.1V?)

I was thinking that the U7300 could be the problem, as reading here on some other similar faults, but replaced it 2 times and all is the same.

Any guidance would we appreciated, this is making me crazy.

Regards

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

U7300 is the first suspect on this model.
However, before change it, check if gets proper voltage and signal to work.
Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L signal and check U7300 basic voltage; pins 11, 10, 1.

"PGOOD_1V1_S5 -> 3.37V (should not be 1.1V?)"
Don't make confusion between a power rail and one of its related signals.
Do you expect to get 1.1V on all U7950 pins with "1V1" included in the signal/power name???
Don't make wrong assumptions so easy in the future...

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Many thanks!

Sorry for the mistake, I'm still learning, I do not distinguish well the nomenclatures used on this boards.

U7300

Pin 11-> 12.08v
Pin 10-> 5.15v
Pin 1-> 3.36v

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Possibly bad chip.
If really good, then check all surrounding resistors and traces.
Also check C7306 and D7301.

Be sure to solder U7300 properly; this board has lot of copper, not easy to heat.
Scratch chip pads and apply leaded solder on them (including laterally) before placing it on the board.
You must get nice solder between board pads and lateral of the chip too.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
C7306 pin1-> 2.15v pin2-> 0v 1.1nF seems OK
D7301 Pin1-> 5.15v pin2-> 6.74v, at diode mode 0.160v and 0v

Will try again to solder the chip, I preheat the board a little to make easy the solder

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: Same result, still no luck

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
U7300 gets power and enable; so should generate 5V_S3.

For surrounding components, I was expected that you check their values (ohm scale; out of board, if needed).
I didn't ask for diode mode to ground on them.
Diode mode to ground on L7320 yes, must be checked.
Be sure all traces and solders are good.
Check U7300 again...

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Hello, will work around, soldered a new one again, and same.

L7320 -> 0.118

R7301-> 99.9K
R7302-> 24.89K
R7304-> 0
R7305-> 7.70K ?? (43.2k)
R7306-> 6.8K ?? (8.06k)
R7310-> 9.92K 
R7311-> 101.1K 
R7312-> 38K  ?? (100k)

Should any of the ?? ones to be desoldered to check out the board? 

The  D7301 Pin1-> 5.093v pin2-> 5.071v 

Many thanks for your advice

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Value for resistors measured on board is lower than nominal; this happens for high values, K/Mohm.

If you get correct power input and enable signal for U7300, I can only suspect bad solders, or broken traces.

When I said "surrounding resistors", I was looking at schematic; some components can be placed on other side of the board.
You may need to replace Q7330/35 and C7326.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Hello, unsoldered the Q7330 and the Q7335, both seems good on readings and gate enabling compared with new ones.
The C7326 reads 102,5nf (0.1uF) seems OK

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: New ones

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: If got all them from same seller, try to find another lot; or get one from scrap board.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: Two lots of 2 units from different sellers, latest ones came in bga sealed packets, tested all four with same results, just because of this I said this make me crazy. Any other thing to check?

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Nothing more that already said.
If chip gets power and enable then must work, if all related components and traces are good.
If not, bad solders....

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: The U7300 gets some hot when powered, around 38C quickly, and also the U1400, if the 7300 was bad, should not heat up? not?

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: This is a very old machine; bad MCP will not be strange at all.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: Do you know a easy way to check for a problem there?

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
What is actual diode mode reading to ground at L7320?
Do you still get 5VREG_EN (after pressing power button)?

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Replace Q7330/35 and D7301 from donor board.
Better to replace the caps too.

Seems to have similar problem.
Check resistance to ground at L7460 (ohm scale).

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Value looks good.
Check U7401 surrounding components.
If all good, change the chip.

BTW, any reason to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above?
Write directly into reply box, instead of clicking Reply button...

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: Just only find a too high diode value at pin 13 of the U7401, 2,056

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message: Just replaced the U7401, now the second light powers up, mounted the system, but powers, fan speeds up and power down again. No post error sounds, no "dong" sound and no screen powering up.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
L7201/21/41 voltage appears?
Check ALL_SYS_PWRGD and PCIE_RESET_L, when fans spin.
You may need to test with other MXM graphics card.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
L7201/21/41 0,01v
ALL_SYS_PWRGD 3.38v
PCIE_RESET_L  0v


The MXM card is a working one.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Tested with a functional CPU, still same. I started the board without CPU and there is 1.28v at the L7201/21/41

Seems that something shorts them with the CPU inside...  Could inject that voltage to find any heating element, if there is any other, apart the cpu.

What do you think?

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
Did you try known good DDR module, each slot at time?
Just in case, try known good BIOS.

threads.title: A1311 late 2009 820-2494A only 1 led non starting
threads.message:
DDR slots tested with the same result.

Did several tries, and sometimes  L7201/21/41  get 1.08v (that should be ok), restarts if self and get 1.28, then powers off. Next manual switch on, starts at 1.28, restarts in 2 seconds and gets 1,53v, then powers off, switch on manually and reads 0.8v and swith off, not appears to me a BIOS issue.

This is quite confuse.
